parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To cry aloud, shriek. A primary verb; properly, to 'croak' or scream, i.e. to call aloud.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
Just as, as, even as. From hos and per; just as, i.e. Exactly like.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To bellow, roar. From a presumed derivative of muzo; to bellow.
A lion. A primary word; a 'lion'.
When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To cry aloud, shriek. A primary verb; properly, to 'croak' or scream, i.e. to call aloud.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Plural

str2: Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
